info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 14 at 4:10PM EDT until September 16 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City NC
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the Beach Hazards Statement, strong longshore currents in the surf zone.
* WHERE...East Carteret County.
* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 5 AM EDT Tuesday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 8 PM EDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Strong longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions.
info.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Strong longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties and other hazardous areas. In many cases, the longshore current is strong enough to prevent swimmers from being able to keep their feet on the bottom making it difficult to return to shore.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT TUESDAY... ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING
